name: Drift Fish
description:
This is my project for the Sumo Digital Rising Star 2017.

I am Stuart Hayes a year 1 student at University of Central Lancashire studying Computer Games Development.

This game was made in about 2 weeks, using the provided files and was restricted to keep in as much in as possible. This game uses Boid's flocking, magnetism and repulsion.

I had no previous experience with Unity before entering this competition. This was a fun challenge and I have learnt a lot about Unity and Boid's flocking.

The idea of this game it eat fish that are the same size as you. When you eat enough fish you grow in size. If you get too close to a fish it will run away from you if you can eat it and if its bigger than you it will chase you.

Controls:

Use the mouse to select the options on the menus.

WASD to move around once in game.
